Comments_List: Quantitative skills specifically related to modeling
In this course I developed an intuitive sense of how reaction rates as well as different types of feedback mechanisms and linked reactions will affect the expression of certain genes/proteins.
Better understood how to use mathematical skills to evaluate biological systems, rather than qualitative understanding of signaling and expression.
I learned how to model biological systems using differential equations.
Knowledge about some concepts in computational biology and mathematical modeling of biological processes, and skills in using the Matlab.

The cause it's really difficult for me, part might due to my language limited, I didn't have time to catch all the things mentioned in the class, and the online note sometime will not cover or will be up load much later
Strengths: accessible to students with minimal background in math

The homework for the course often required understanding of the math that was far above that which was taught in class (e.g. was skipped over) in order to get the insights necessary to understand how to do the problems.

I thought this class was taught very well.  I thought it progressed at a good pace, and I thought the material was very interesting.  I thought it was wonderful that almost all of the material for the class was posted online.

I thought the class got rather biology-intensive towards the end.  I suspect the vast majority of the students were in subfields of biology, but since this class was listed in a number of non-biology departments, I wish there would have been a little bit more support for the non-biology majors.

My only gripe was that the papers in particular took a very long time to get graded.  By the time the fourth and final one was due, only the first one had been graded.  It's kind of hard to improve your mistakes if you're not getting feedback.
The course is very well organized
Yes, it a really interesting course to knowing dynamic and system biology. But if you don't have a strong background in math and chemical. Auditorium might be a better choice
Yes, this class brought together biology and quantitative methods
I would need better TAs that were more willing to help students prior to recommending.
Yes, I would recommend this class to another student.  I thought it was a very well-taught class.
Yes. It is a great course for students with little computional biology background and who want to learn more about this field.
